title: Suspect in Woonsocket shooting surrenders to police
content:
Police say Zackary Alvarado, 19, is a suspect in a shooting near Aly's Bar, at 80 River St., in Woonsocket, that injured four people shortly after 1 a.m. He turned himself in at police headquarters and will be charged with four counts of felony assault with a dangerous weapon, firing in a compact area, disorderly conduct and having no permit to carry a pistol.
WOONSOCKET, R.I. - Police say a 19-year-old man wanted in connection with a shooting near Aly's Bar, 80 River St., that injured four people shortly after 1 a.m. Friday has turned himself in.
Police say Zackary Alvarado, who turned himself in at police headquarters Friday afternoon, is being charged with four counts of felony assault with a dangerous weapon, firing in a compact area, disorderly conduct and having no permit to carry a pistol.
Four people with gunshot wounds were taken to Rhode Island Hospital with non-life threatening injuries, police said.
WPRI-TV reported that fire officials said that the shootings occurred at two separate locations.
-- With reports the Associated Press
